metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10051 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Suricata 4.1.3. If the functionfiletracker_newchunk encounters an unsafe "Some(sfcm) => { ft.new_chunk }"item, then the program enters an smb/files.rs error condition and crashes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

suricata - 1:4.1.4-1
suricata-oinkmaster - 1:4.1.4-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: suricata package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.4-1').
